subject: Management
title: Psychological Safety in Change
description: A quick win: understand Psychological Safety in Change.

hook.text: A hospital redesigned its surgical process. Only teams with high psychological safety adopted it successfully.

buildup.text: Change requires people to admit they don't know the new way. That's vulnerable.

discovery.text: Amy Edmondson: teams with safety adopt change faster because asking for help isn't punished.

twist.text: In unsafe teams, people fake adoption to avoid looking incompetent. The change looks done but isn't.

climax.text: Build safety before launching change. Make it okay to struggle, ask questions, and learn publicly.

punchline.text: Safe teams change faster. Invest in safety before you invest in change.

quiz.question: Why is psychological safety essential during organizational change?
options: People need to admit they don't know the new way without fear of punishment
Safety has no impact on how quickly teams adopt changes
Only leaders need to feel safe during change, not the broader team
